tasks.task: Physically prepare and install a solar irrigation system on a farm.
subtasks: Research and select the appropriate number and type of solar panels based on farm needs and local sunlight conditions.
Determine the necessary pump type (surface or submersible) and installation method for the water source.
Assemble the required tools and equipment, including piping, valves, and mounting brackets.
Securely mount the solar panels in a sunlit, unobstructed area with proper angling for maximum efficiency.
Wire the solar panels together in the correct configuration (series or parallel) to match the pump's power requirements.
Install the chosen pump at the water source (surface or submersible), ensuring proper base stability or secure lowering into the water.
Connect the piping or drip irrigation system to the pump and distribute water to the field, considering necessary valves for area segmentation.
Test the entire irrigation system to ensure proper water flow and make any necessary adjustments to connections.
Regularly clean and inspect the solar panels, pump, and irrigation system components to maintain efficiency and prevent leaks.

tasks.task: Plan the location for the solar irrigation system to optimize sunlight exposure.
subtasks: Identify a site with maximum direct sunlight and minimal obstructions for solar panel placement.
Ensure proximity to the water source to minimize energy requirements for the pump.
Check local wind conditions and select brackets that can securely hold the solar panels.

tasks.task: Wire the solar panels and pump correctly.
subtasks: Configure the solar panels in series or parallel based on the need to increase voltage or current.
Connect the solar panel wires to the pump, ensuring compatibility and proper voltage.

tasks.task: Install the pump based on its type (surface or submersible).
subtasks: For surface pumps, find a stable base near the water source and secure the pump with bolts or straps.
For submersible pumps, lower them into the water source carefully, ensuring cable security.
Connect the pump to the water source using compatible piping and seal all connections tightly.

tasks.task: Set up the irrigation system.
subtasks: Lay out drip lines or connect traditional pipes to the pump.
Install valves for controlling water flow to different sections of the farm.

tasks.task: Test the irrigation system for functionality.
subtasks: Check all connections for leaks and ensure consistent water flow.
Address any issues such as leaks immediately.

tasks.task: Perform regular maintenance on the solar irrigation system.
subtasks: Clean solar panels periodically to remove debris.
Inspect and replace pump and piping components as needed.
Monitor the pump's oil level and refill as necessary.
